chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Your Response:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

Your Response:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
None

Goal:
forall n : nat, n <> 0 -> n <> 1 -> {p : nat & {m : nat & {q : nat | is_prime p /\ m > 0 /\ n = power p m * q /\ is_gcd 1 p q /\ q < n}}}

Premises:
Inductive nat : Set := O : nat | S : nat -> nat Arguments S _%nat_scope
is_gcd = fun d a b : nat => is_cd d a b /\ (forall d' : nat, is_cd d' a b -> divides d d') : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
power = fix power (x n : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 1 | S n0 => x * power x n0 end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments power (_ _)%nat_scope
is_prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall d : nat, divides p d -> d = 1 \/ d = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments is_prime _%nat_scope
euclide : forall a b : nat, b <> 0 -> {q : nat & {r : nat | a = b * q + r /\ r < b}}
divides_nat : forall n : nat, {p : nat | p <> 1 /\ p <> n /\ divides n p} + {forall p : nat, p <> 1 -> p <> n -> ~ divides n p}
prime_cond : forall p : nat, p <> 1 /\ (forall a : nat, a <> 1 -> a <> p -> ~ divides p a) < -> is_prime p
nat_factor : forall n p : nat, is_prime p -> n <> 0 -> {m : nat | divides n (power p m) /\ ~ divides n (power p (m + 1))}
divides_prime : forall a : nat, (exists p : nat, p <> a /\ is_prime p /\ divides a p) -> ~ is_prime a
plus_is_one : forall m n : nat, m + n = 1 -> {m = 0 /\ n = 1} + {m = 1 /\ n = 0}
not_prime_impl_prime_divides : forall n : nat, ~ is_prime n -> {p : nat | is_prime p /\ divides n p} + {n = 1}
power_lt : forall p m : nat, 1 < p -> 0 < m -> 1 < power p m
gcd_prime : forall p : nat, p <> 1 -> (forall d a : nat, is_gcd d a p -> d = 1 \/ d = p) -> is_prime p
prime_power_qn : forall p n q x : nat, is_prime p -> divides (power x n) (power p (q * n)) -> 1 <= n -> divides x (power p q)
mult_lemma5 : forall n m : nat, n * m = 1 -> n = 1 /\ m = 1
mult_lemma3 : forall n m : nat, n <> 0 -> m > 1 -> n < n * m
divides = fun a b : nat => exists q : nat, a = b * q : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
prime_gcd : forall d p a : nat, is_prime p -> is_gcd d a p -> d = 1 \/ d = p
dec_impl_lt_dec : forall P : nat -> Prop, (forall n : nat, {P n} + {~ P n}) -> forall m : nat, {n : nat | n < m /\ P n} + {forall n : nat, n < m -> ~ P n}
mult_lt_compat_r : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> 0 < p -> n * p < m * p
not_prime_zero = fun H : 0 <> 1 /\ (forall d : nat, divides 0 d -> d = 1 \/ d = 0) => and_ind (fun (_ : 0 <> 1) (H1 : forall d : nat, divides 0 d -> d = 1 \/ d = 0) => match H1 2 (zero_max_div 2) with | or_introl H2 => let H3 : False := eq_ind 2 (fun e : nat => match e with | S (S _) => True | _ => False end) I 1 H2 in False_ind False H3 | or_intror H2 => let H3 : False := eq_ind 2 (fun e : nat => match e with | 0 => False | S _ => True end) I 0 H2 in False_ind False H3 end) H : ~ is_prime 0
bezout_exists : forall a b : nat, {u : nat & {v : nat | is_gcd (a * u - b * v) a b}} + {u : nat & {v : nat | is_gcd (b * v - a * u) a b}}
quotient_euclide : nat -> forall b : nat, b <> 0 -> nat
remainder_euclide : nat -> forall b : nat, b <> 0 -> nat
Init.Nat.mul = fix mul (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => 0 | S p => m + mul p m end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.mul (_ _)%nat_scope
intro_Z : forall n : nat, exists y : Z, Z.of_nat n = y /\ (0 <= y * 1 + 0)%Z
Init.Nat.add = fix add (n m : nat) {struct n} : nat := match n with | 0 => m | S p => S (add p m) end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.add (_ _)%nat_scope
gt_trans_S : forall n m p : nat, S n > m -> m > p -> n > p
Nat.lt_trans : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> m < p -> n < p
is_cd = fun d a b : nat => divides a d /\ divides b d : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_cd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
Nat.lt_le_trans : forall n m p : nat, n < m -> m <= p -> n < p
prime_div_gcd : forall p a : nat, is_prime p -> ~ divides a p -> rel_prime p a
prime_rel_prime : forall p a : nat, is_prime p -> ~ rel_prime a p -> divides a p
prime_square : forall p a : nat, is_prime p -> divides (square a) p -> divides a p

```coq
intros n Hn0 Hn1.
destruct (not_prime_impl_prime_divides n) as [[p [Hp_prime Hp_div_n]] | H_prime_n].
- exists p.
  destruct (nat_factor n p Hp_prime Hn0) as [m [Hdiv_power_m Hn_div_power_succ_m]].
  assert (Hm_gt_0: m > 0).
  { destruct m.
    + exfalso. apply Hn_div_power_succ_m. simpl. exists n. rewrite Nat.mul_1_r. auto.
    + lia. }
  destruct (euclide n (power p m)) as [q [r [H_eq H_lt]]].
  + intro H. rewrite H in Hn0. contradiction.
  exists m, q.
  repeat split.
  + apply Hp_prime.
  + exact Hm_gt_0.
  + rewrite H_eq. f_equal. apply mult_comm.
  + intros d H_cd. unfold is_gcd in *. intuition.
    -- apply prime_gcd with (a := q) (b := p) (c := n). 
       ++ exact Hp_prime.
       ++ unfold is_cd in H_cd. destruct H_cd. split; auto. 
    -- auto.
  + lia.
- exfalso. destruct H_prime_n as [|]; exact H.
Qed.
```

original: intros n Hn0 Hn1. destruct (not_prime_impl_prime_divides n) as [[p [Hp_prime Hp_div_n]] | H_prime_n]. - exists p. destruct (nat_factor n p Hp_prime Hn0) as [m [Hdiv_power_m Hn_div_power_succ_m]]. assert (Hm_gt_0: m > 0). { destruct m. + exfalso. apply Hn_div_power_succ_m. simpl. exists n. rewrite Nat.mul_1_r. auto. + lia. } destruct (euclide n (power p m)) as [q [r [H_eq H_lt]]]. + intro H. rewrite H in Hn0. contradiction. exists m, q. repeat split. + apply Hp_prime. + apply Hm_gt_0. + rewrite H_eq. f_equal. apply mult_comm. + intros d H_cd. unfold is_gcd in *. intuition. -- apply prime_gcd with (a := q) (b := p) (c := n). ++ apply Hp_prime. ++ unfold is_cd in H_cd. destruct H_cd. split; auto. -- auto. + lia. - exfalso. destruct H_prime_n as [|]; apply H.
